results.title: Work of the blood [Colour]
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Hal Kopel
results.brief_description: The laboratory analysis of a blood sample reveals the structure of cells and the composition of plasma. Demonstrates the function of the blood, methods of analysing blood types and the giving of transfusions.

results.title: Work it out (Captioned)
results.brief_description: A video, aimed at young women between the ages of 14-20 years, that examines career opportunities available. The subject areas covered include : Women at Work; Careers Counselling; Equal Opportunity; Personal Development; Industrial relations; Social Studies.

results.title: Work it out
results.brief_description: Work It Out provides attractive and undaunting options for young women through the real life experiences of a group of eleven women. The women interviewed are quiet achievers with whom young women can readily identify.

results.title: Work is a four letter word: I'm here to be got at (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Jimmy Dunn, a full time convenor at the Massey Ferguson plant in Coventry is paid by the company but is there to serve the interests of, and listen to the grievances of union members. He feels he is “there to be got at”. How powerful is he and how well does he use that power?

results.title: Work can be measured: a work measurement study on a power loaded face
results.creator_credit: National Coal Board, Kitty Marshall and Ralph Elton
results.brief_description: Deals with the application of the technique of work study methods in the mine. A study is made of the work on a power-loaded coalface by breaking down the work into elements, assessing the speed of the workers, taking into account the degrees of monotony, and calculating manning economies.
results.title_for_label: Work can be measured: a work measurement study on a power loaded face
results.creator_credit_for_label: National Coal Board, Kitty Marshall and Ralph Elton

results.title: Work around the clock
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Alfred Hospital, Helen Gaynor and Ivo Burum
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Nurses”.
Nurses “was filmed by four nurses and their friends at the Alfred Hospital in Melbourne to capture the real life drama of nursing from a very different perspective…their own” Nurses are: Kerryn O’Rourke - Oncology. Trish Builic - Psychiatric (to the homeless). Jane Newham - Emergency. Cassie Steward - Theatre. Ep 2: Opens with wonderfully honest scene about the difficulties of getting up in the morning, and the way the twenty-four hour, year round demands of nursing that throw your body and personal life out. Jane, who has been in a relationship for five months talks about the cycle of crankiness that comes whenever she works nights. And the difficulties of getting a partner, used to a nine to five work day, to understand. Trish, who has just been proposed to (lots of drama) says upfront that she chose to specialise in psychiatric because she didn’t think she could work nights relentlessly, and even so she still carries responsibility beyond working hours. Kerryn takes the audience through a night shift and we see that its the little things that get you through, brushing your teeth, coming home to clean bed sheets. And in theatre there are some gory scenes, before Cassie takes us out the back for a cigarette…
